text_column.text: Each Text Column block is stacked on top of each vertically and fills the width of the article container.
Appearance order is first column to last.
Text Column blocks appear 2-on-a-row, with additional rows wrapping to a new section underneath the previous two.
Appearance order is first column to last.
Each Text Column takes up an equal amount of space in the article container.
Each Text Column takes up an equal amount of space in the article container.

text_columns_header.text: A slice that creates up to 5 columns of Text Block slices.

text_columns_footer.text: Add the One Image and Text slice to your document.
(OPTIONAL) Add text details to the Text Columns header section.
(OPTIONAL) Add text details to the Text Columns footer section.
Add your content to the Text Column in the Repeatable Zone.
Add as many columns as needed, up to a maximum of 5.
One Column to Four Column example layouts: shown below.
Five Columns: See the Image Row slice, Multiple Images, Mixed Aspect Ratios section of the article for a real-life example of a five-column layout and how it can be used.
Heading 1 is disabled in this Text Section of slice for the same reason it's disabled in the Text slice: Heading 1 is the title of the article.
If no content is added to a Text Column in the Repeatable Zone, the entire slice will not appear in the article (prevents broken layouts).

text_column.text: One Text Column Appears as a Regular Text Block

text_columns_header.text: The header section is optional and appears above the text columns.
You can use it to explain the content in the Text Columns that will follow.
You can see the Text Columns slice in action in the description

text_columns_footer.text: The footer section is optional and appears above the text columns.
You can use it to add any final details to the Text Columns data that was just presented.

body_text.text: A slice that allows you to pair a text block alongside an image. This slice gives ‚Öî of the article container's space to the text, ‚Öì to the image.
Add the One Image and Text slice to your document.
Click the slice label icon (the tag-like icon) located right to the name of the slice.
Select one of the four layouts.
Add your text content. Works just like the Text slice.
If you choose a tall image layout, you can fit more content alongside the image; less when paired with the wide image.
If you forget to choose a layout, the One Image and Text slice will default to the Left: Tall Image-Text layout.
If you forget to add an image, the text section will take up the whole width of the article layout, not the whole width of the page.
Heading 1 is disabled in this Text Section of slice for the same reason it's disabled in the Text slice: Heading 1 is the title of the article.

Add the HMBK Item and Text slice to your document.
Click the slice label icon (the tag-like icon) located right to the name of the slice.
Select one of the two layouts.
Add your text content. Works just like the Text slice.
You can select from one of two layout options.
If you forget to choose a layout, the HMBK Item and Text slice will default to the Left: Card -- Text layout.
If you forget to add an HMBK Item, the text section will take up the whole width of the article container.
Heading 1 is disabled in this Text Section of slice for the same reason it's disabled in the Text slice: Heading 1 is the title of the article.

event_blurb.text: One morning, when Gregor Samsa woke from troubled dreams.

One morning, when Gregor Samsa woke from troubled dreams, he found himself transformed in his bed into a horrible vermin. He lay on his armour-like back, and if he lifted his head a little he could see his brown belly, slightly domed and divided by arches into stiff sections. The bedding was hardly able to cover it and seemed ready to slide off any moment. His many legs, pitifully thin compared with the size of the rest of him, waved about helplessly as he looked. "What's happened to me? " he thought. It wasn't a dream. His room, a proper human room although a little too small, lay peacefully between its four familiar walls.

One morning, when Gregor Samsa woke from troubled dreams, he found himself transformed in his bed into a horrible vermin. He lay on his armour-like back, and if he lifted his head a little he could see his brown belly, slightly domed and divided by arches into stiff sections. The bedding was hardly able to cover it and seemed ready to slide off any moment. His many legs, pitifully thin compared with the size of the rest of him, waved about helplessly as he looked. "What's happened to me? " he thought. It wasn't a dream. His room, a proper human room although a little too small, lay peacefully between its four familiar walls.

body_text.text: A slice that allows you to pair a text block alongside an image. This slice gives a ¬Ω of the article container's space to the text, ¬º to each image.
Add the One Image and Text slice to your document.
Click the slice label icon (the tag-like icon) located right to the name of the slice.
Select one of the two layouts.
Add your text content. Works just like the Text slice.
You can select from two layouts.
If you forget to choose a layout, the Two Image and Text slice will default to the Left: Text -- Image -- Image layout.
If you forget to add an image, the text section will take up the whole width of the article layout, not the whole width of the page.
Heading 1 is disabled in this Text Section of slice for the same reason it's disabled in the Text slice: Heading 1 is the title of the article.

body_text.text: A slice that showcases a quote in big styled text.
Add the Blockquote slice to your document.
Click the slice label icon (the tag-like icon) located right to the name of the slice.
Select one of the three layouts.
Add your quote and attribution (who said it, what context)
You can select from three available styles:
None: solid black background; white quote text
Light: light-color background image; black quote text
Dark: dark background image; white quote text
If you choose a tall image layout, you can fit more content alongside the image; less when paired with the wide image.
If you forget to choose a layout, the One Image and Text slice will default to the Left: Tall Image-Text layout.
If you forget to add an image, the text section will take up the whole width of the article layout, not the whole width of the page.
Heading 1 is disabled in this Text Section of slice for the same reason it's disabled in the Text slice: Heading 1 is the title of the article.

blockquote_text.text: Exploration is in our nature. We began as wanderers, and we are  wanderers still. We have lingered long enough on the shores of the  cosmic ocean. We are ready at last to set sail for the stars.
You have brains in your head. You have feet in your shoes. You can steer yourself any direction you choose.
Books are the quietest and most constant of friends; they are the most accessible and wisest of counselors, and the most patient of teachers.

body_text.text: A slice that displays a up to 12 (twelve) images on a single row.
Add the Row of Images slice to your document.
Add the images you'd like to appear next to each other in a row.
You can select from three available layouts.
If you forget to add images to this slice, this slice will not appear in your article. (Prevents page layout errors)
Two Wide Images, Same Aspect Ratio
Three Tall Images, Same Aspect Ratio

Add the Full Width Image slice to your document.
Click the slice label icon (the tag-like icon) located right to the name of the slice.
Select one of the three layouts.
Select your image and adjust how you'd like to present the image.
You can select from three available layouts.
If you forget to choose a layout, the Full Width Image slice will default to the Medium layout.
If you forget to add an image, this slice will not appear in your article. (Prevents page layout errors)
